column2: Job Requirements?  Should have experience in Green Field Integrated Steel Plant project of > 1.0 MTPA right from Concept to Commissioning.?  Should have hands on experience heading the Steel Making Shop Project > 1.0 MTPA.?  Experienced in technology finalization and should have hands on experience in technological discussions of SMS - BOF & CASTER with principle technology suppliers and package equipment suppliers for SMS - BOF & CASTER Project.?  Should have handled technical aspects of critical BOF & Caster packages during order finalization, Basic & Detailed Engg, manufacturing, installation & commissioning.?  Should have hands on experience in budget estimation skills, budget monitoring & control.?  Should possess project monitoring skills to prepare and review MIS daily / weekly / fortnightly / monthly progress reports and should possess ability to analyse the project delays and discuss mitigation measures with Vice President - Steel.?  Should possess skills such as resource mapping, resource contention mgmt., contractor mgmt, project mgmt.?  Should have experience in handling the erection of Civil, Structure, Equipment, Piping & refractory jobs of Steel Making Shop.?  Should possess hands on experience in erection & commissioning of Steel Making Shop equipment.?  Should have rich experience in HSE, ensuring safety & statutory compliances, preparation of HIRA /HAZOP reports.?  Should have exposure executing the Cold trials & commissioning of all equipment & accessories related to Steel Making Shop.?  Exposure in the O &M of BOF/Caster would be an added advantage.   Role and Responsibilities?  Ensure seamless execution of Steel Making Shop Project.?  Lead the technical discussions during the finalization of BOF & Caster Technology with principle technology suppliers and prepare the Technical comparatives.?  Lead the technical discussions during the finalization of critical packages of Steel Making Shop with various package suppliers and prepare the Technical comparatives.?  Lead the Kick-Off meeting, Basic Data, Basic Engineering & Detailed Engineering b/w all relevant stake holders for timely completion of SMS - BOF & CASTER project.?  Lead the discussions with technical/commercial project manager and all relevant stake holders for any variations in the technical scope of supply with supporting documentation for claims/ counter claims settlement.?  Ensure timely delivery/commissioning of SMS - BOF & CASTER project.?  Ensure the preparation, updating & timely presenting the detailed Project Time Schedule for regular review and updating to Vice President-Steel.  Ensure the preparation, updating & timely presenting the detailed budget for regular review and updating to Vice President - Steel.?  Ensure all strategic and tactical goals are met in areas including customer satisfaction, safety, quality and team member performance?  Identify risks and put in place risk mitigation plan?  Proactively identify and highlight risks of delays to the VP Steel?  Identify bottlenecks and recommend solutions?  Ensure seamless communication among all stakeholders?  Interface with external consultants/ vendors/ agencies etc. for ensure seamless communication and timely execution of engagements?  Any other work assigned to you from time to time

column1: Head -  Engineering  - Specialty Steel Greenfield Projects
column2: Job Description   :- Lead the engineering function for the 700,000 TPA total capacity to 1.3 TPA.   Speciality Steel Greenfield   Projects, with a core responsibility to plan, design and deliver engineering solutions focused on Best Available Technology (BAT) deployment, design optimization, value engineering, project execution, on-time, and within-budget delivery, managing multi-discipline engineering subcontractors and other professionals. The Engineering Head will also provide technology upgradation and equipment maintenance support to the existing production facilities, enhance the use of new machines to improve organization's efficiencies. Specifications of the Ideal Candidate :- -  Seniority profile :-  The incumbent should have about 15 - 20 years of steel industry experience, and as a project   engineering team leader for at least past 5 years. He must be reasonably conversant with modern project management methodologies.  -  Domain :-  Metals and mining preferably with integrated operations, Industrial products, Capital Goods, process industries. Strategic experience in project execution, evaluating new technologies and processes that enhance operations and efficiency. Engineering Consulting & Project Management background  :- Can also look at consulting companies such as Bechtel, Tecpro Systems, MECON, Dastur, CBRI etc.  Scale :-  Should have led large engineering function for greenfield or expansion project for a stand-alone business or a division within a larger group .   Qualification :  - BE/ BTech/ MTech and an MBA  Preferably a certified PMP/ PgMP/ PfMP/Prince2 etc. and conversant with modern project management -  IT Skills-set    :- Softwares like MSP, Primavera P6 etc.

column2: CEO Solar C&I will report to the Managing Director and will be responsible for Fund raising, Strategy, Business development, operations of the vertical.  Establishing the vertical of solar power project development, in the company, (roof top & ground mounted) wherein he will be responsible to look after business development, project conceptualization, project initiation, liaison with government authorities, securing approvals and permissions, strategy, securing prospective customers for sale of power, power purchase agreements execution, contributing in establishing the solar operational structure in company. The job description is as follows  Key Responsibilities Responsible for raising funds, manage funds and handle the entire P&L. Responsible for building (Commercial & Industrial) sector customers for solar power roof-top and ground mounted. Developing and executing a long term strategy and implementation plan for scaling the C&I business. Creating a detailed and actionable plan with clearly defined milestones and targets Understanding the current market dynamics & trends, techno-commercial needs of various customer segments within C&I, and the policy environment to inform the go-to-market strategy. Understanding the requirement of company leadership and transforming it to executable implementation plan. Scouting for new projects, business development, project conceptualization, project initiation, site solicitation, land acquisition etc. Securing permissions and approvals from state nodal agencies for project establishment, from transmission authorities (STU and CTU) for connectivity, etc. Should have technical understanding about the design, procurement, installation and commissioning of solar plants Effectively deploying and managing a team to oversee the rapid roll-out as per action plan to demonstrate proof of concept and informing the strategy for scale across priority geographies. He will liaise with clients to understand their requirements and work on deliverables in time bound manner as agreed with client. The candidate shall also be required to carry out business development activities. Identifying the need for and leading the development of internal reports, quarterly reviews and internal and external communications as needed. Identification of major Business opportunities by Sales and Business development.  Spearheading project management process from the conceptual development stage through final construction, making sure that the project gets done on time and within budget To work with internal & external stakeholders on an assigned project to identify solutions to business problems and streamlines processes Desired Profile An Engineering graduate with an MBA with 15+ yrs of experience in Solar C&I projects (both rooftop and ground mounted) Candidate should be currently heading a business unit at a Director or VP or CEO level managing solar projects Should have good experience in establishing and driving sales operations for Rooftop and ground mounted solar C&I markets Excellent leadership skills along with strong business skills to scale up the business Ability to anticipate future opportunities and consequences and devise innovative approaches to address them.

column2: Key Responsibilities: Vendor Coordination and Management: Assist in identifying and evaluating potential suppliers, subcontractors, and service providers. Communicate with vendors to obtain quotes, negotiate prices, and finalize purchase agreements. Maintain vendor relationships and address any issues or concerns related to deliveries or quality.    Purchase Order Processing: Generate and process purchase orders based on project requirements and budgetary constraints. Ensure accuracy and completeness of purchase orders, including specifications, quantities, and delivery schedules. Monitor and track the status of purchase orders to ensure timely delivery and fulfillment. Material Procurement and Inventory Control: Assist in sourcing construction materials, equipment, and supplies as per project specifications. Coordinate with warehouse and logistics teams to manage inventory levels and stock replenishment. Conduct regular inventory audits and reconcile discrepancies to maintain accurate inventory records. Cost Analysis and Budgeting: Assist in analyzing supplier quotes and proposals to determine cost-effectiveness and value for money. Support in budgeting and forecasting procurement expenses for construction projects. Identify opportunities for cost savings and efficiency improvements in procurement processes. Quality Assurance and Compliance: Assist in ensuring that procured materials and equipment meet quality standards and specifications. Collaborate with project managers and quality control teams to address any quality issues or concerns. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain procurement documentation, including purchase orders, contracts, invoices, and supplier agreements. Prepare regular reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and vendor performance. Assist in analyzing procurement data and trends to inform decision-making and process improvements. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in procurement or purchasing, preferably in the construction industry. Strong negotiation skills and ability to communicate effectively with vendors and internal stakeholders. Proficiency in MS Office Suite and procurement software. Knowledge of construction materials, equipment, and specifications. Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills. Additional Requirements: Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Adaptability to changing priorities and deadlines. Willingness to learn and grow within the procurement function.

column2: Accountable for the SAP Plant M    aintenance Module and Material Management Module activities    for the Ankleshwar plant. Coordinate and plan for all maintenance Workorder/Notifications Related activities for the site, including Preventive Maintenance, Corrective Maintenance, and Shut down activities      Maintain the Preventive Maintenance program for the site to ensure all Equipment / Structure / Buildings / Facilities related Preventive Maintenance carried out.      Ensure all maintenance / repair / certification records are Updated in the PM/MM system of SAP. (entering Data in SAP PM Software)      Ensure all maintenance issues are recorded and participate in Root cause analysis (RCAs) on the events and issues learning from SAP Notifications/Workorders history.      Lead daily meeting with Operations and other stakeholders to plan and prioritize maintenance jobs in SAP PM System.      Lead/Generate Various MIS Reports related to SAP Plant Maintenance/Material Management Module.      Issue weekly/monthly report on overdue and outstanding Preventive Maintenance/Breakdown Maintenance from SAP PM/MM Module. Extend / Support / Guidance on SAP PM / MM related query to Electrical / Instrument / Mechanical / Engineering Stores Group.      Serve as a champion for all SAP PM / MM Module improvement plans/ideas to raise System Compliance with Internal and External Vendors. Issue monthly Inventory report.      Issue monthly PM/MM SAP Report of Notifications, work orders, PM Orders, material master code, Bill of material. SAP PM/MM Module knowledge is mandatory Operation of SAP PM / MM Application Software. column2: The Chief of the Party holds the dual responsibility of providing technical leadership and administrative supervision for the project. They also serve as the primary institutional point of contact with USAID. Additionally, the COP will play a central role in coordinating Project Partners and Project Implementation Units.                ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES          Programs            Collaborate with a variety of monasteries to enhance access to ancient Tibetan manuscripts, establishing robust partnerships and nurturing the preservation of Tibetan cultural heritage.          Take the lead in the digitization of priceless Tibetan manuscripts, creating efficient methods to capture and safeguard this cultural legacy for future generations.          Engage with the Tibetan community to identify and enlist individuals for data annotation tasks, offering training and guidance to enhance their abilities. Ensure that this initiative results in increased job opportunities for community members.          Develop programs to empower project stakeholders with the necessary skills to oversee, sustain, and enhance the technological solutions developed, thus promoting self-reliance and self-sufficiency.          Cultivate strategic alliances with prominent technology firms to secure funding and gain access to top-tier talent for collaborative endeavors aimed at advancing our technological solutions.                    Chief of Party (COP), USAID            The Chief of Party (COP) is responsible for achieving program goals, overseeing operations, and liaising with USAID and government officials. The COPs role involves aligning the projects objectives with the broader strategies of these stakeholders.          Conducts and leads review meetings both within the organization and with USAID. These meetings are essential for keeping all stakeholders informed about the projects progress and addressing any challenges promptly.          The COP plays a critical role in identifying, managing, and regularly tracking project updates. This ensures that the project stays on course, making adjustments as necessary to meet its objectives effectively.          Beyond managing grants and approvals, the COP is responsible for financial oversight, monitoring, and control. This includes conducting quarterly audits and preparing comprehensive reports to analyze and manage expenses.          Ensuring that Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) reports are published in the accepted periodicity is a vital responsibility. These reports help in assessing the impact of the project, making data-driven decisions, and improving its outcomes.          Serves as a central figure in the projects leadership, responsible for steering it in the right direction, ensuring accountability, and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders.          Actively identifies new business opportunities and ideates proposals, contributing to the growth and sustainability of the organization and the project.                    REQUIREMENTS            12-15 years of experience in the field of Social Impact / Social Work.          Extensive experience in managing grants from USAID or other donor organizations.          Proficiency in crafting reports and proposals for business development, collaborating with a diverse range of domestic and international donors.          Background in collaborating with emerging markets and technologies.          Expertise in effectively collaborating with teams thriving in a multicultural work environment.          Proficiency in technical writing, including the ability to synthesize research findings and generate content for proposal sections, among other tasks.          Proficient computer skills, particularly in Microsoft Office Suite applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.          Robust interpersonal and organizational abilities, with the capability to effectively prioritize deadlines and operate in fast-paced environments and teams, all while upholding accuracy.
column11: Administration, Project leadership, Technical writing, Artificial Intelligence, Healthcare, Strategic alliances, Research, MS Office, Monitoring, Public health
